chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Ambrose LDV McDaniel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive, with credit for 161 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
- No contact with ZB, ZRM or EMB.
- No contact with anyone under the age of 16 years of age without consent of PO agent.

- Cooperate with sex offender treatment.
- Comply with sex offender registry. 
- Absolute sobriety with random testing.

supervisions.notes:
- Court orders restitution set at $0.
- Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
- Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges.   
- As to all costs and surcharges, Court orders DOC shall collect prison funds at an amount or percentage deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections.  Remaining balance to be collected during the period of extended supervision. Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.  Cash bail to apply.

- Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, body armor or ammunition.
- Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ambrose LDV McDaniel in court, in custody.  Attorney Colleen A Taylor in court for Ambrose LDV McDaniel.  Attorney Jack T Eichorst in court for State of Wisconsin. State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing hearing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing. 

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 288 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE), with credit for 161 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 144 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 144 MONTHS.  
The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program". 

Court orders the following conditions of extended supervision: 
- cooperate with sex offender treatment
- comply with sex offender registry
- no contact with ZB, ZRM or EMB
- absolute sobriety with random testing
- maintain work and/or school 
- no contact with anyone under the age of 16 years of age without consent of PO agent

Court orders restitution set at $0. 
  
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges.   
As to all costs and surcharges, Court orders DOC shall collect prison funds at an amount or percentage deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections.  Remaining balance to be collected during the period of extended supervision.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.  Cash bail to apply.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, body armor or ammunition.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant of his right to seek post conviction relief.

Filed,

Per Order dated October 5, 2022, Appeal No 2022XX484-CR, 
IT IS ORDERED that the motion and all accompanying requests for relief are dismissed. There is still no matter pending before this court involving Mr. McDaniel in which this court's jurisdiction has been properly invoked. Mr. McDaniel's current motion and letter reference State v. McDaniel, Milwaukee County Case No. 2022CF226. According to the Wisconsin Circuit Court Access (WCCA) website, that case remains open and pending before the Milwaukee County Circuit Court. No final judgment has been entered in that case that could permit an appeal as of right. In such situations, requests for relief should ordinarily be filed in the trial court. Furthermore, according to WCCA entries for Milwaukee County Case No. 2022CF226, Mr. McDaniel continues to be represented by counsel in that case. Consequently, requests for relief or any future appeal when permitted should ordinarily be made through counsel.

Case recalled at 10:46 am.  Appearances remain the same.  At the hour of 10:45 am the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction. Court orders defendant REMANDED pending sentencing hearing. Matter adjourned for sentencing in Branch 37.
Exhibit List, filed

Defendant Ambrose LDV McDaniel in court.  Attorney Colleen A Taylor in court for Ambrose LDV McDaniel.  At defense table is legal intern Dean Sobcic  Attorney Jack T Eichorst in court for State of Wisconsin.   Jurors were together at 8:50 am in the jury room for deliberation.  Jury question and court's response. Jury question filed.   Jury in box at 9:18 am. Jury viewed Exhibit 1 in court. Jury out of box at 9:55 am to return to deliberations.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ambrose LDV McDaniel in court.  Attorney Colleen A Taylor in court for Ambrose LDV McDaniel. At defense counsel table is legal intern Dean Sobcic.  Attorney Jack T Eichorst in court for State of Wisconsin. Jury in box at 1:25 pm.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 1:55 pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Carlton Thomas and David Briscoe who were duly sworn for that purpose.  Jury List filed.  Case in recess as the jury deliberates.
*
Case recalled at 4:27 pm.  Appearances remain the same.  Court informed the parties that the jury has not reached an unanimous decision and is deadlocked.  
*
Jury in box at 4:30 pm. Court reads a jury instruction to the jury.  Jury released for the day at 4:32 pm and instructed to return the next day at 8:30 am to continue deliberations.

Defendant Ambrose LDV McDaniel in court.  Attorney Colleen A Taylor in court for Ambrose LDV McDaniel. At defense counsel table is legal intern Dean Sobcic.   Attorney Jack T Eichorst in court for State of Wisconsin.   Jury in box at 8:38 am.  MPD Jolene Del Moral in witness box who remains previously sworn.  Exhibit 1 published to the jury.  Testimony of MPD Del Moral heard. Sworn for the state:  Zynyah M. Jury break at 9:50 am.  Jury back in box at 10:05 am.  Sworn for the state:  Zanovia M.  Sworn for the state:  MPO Michael Maldonado.  State rest subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box at 10:20 am. Court held colloquy with defendant.  Defendant advised of right to testify and right to not testify.  Court examined defendant as to his waiver of his right to testify.  Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives his right to testify.  Defense motion for a directed verdict heard and denied as stated on the record.  Jury instruction conference held.  Jury in box at 11:02 am.  Defense rest. Court instructed the jury.  Jury lunch at 11:16 am and instructed to return at 1:15 pm to continue with the jury trial.

Outside the presence of the jury court placed jury trial scheduling on the record and addressed preliminary matters.  Court ruled on defense motion as to to state's first witness. Jury in box at 3:37 pm.  Jury sworn.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Detective (MPD) Jolene Del Moral. Exhibit 1, received and filed.  Jury recessed for the day at 4:14 pm and instructed to return at 8:15 am the next day to continue with the jury trial.  court made a record of strikes for cause.  Parties recessed for the day.

Defendant Ambrose LDV McDaniel in court.  Attorney Colleen A Taylor in court for Ambrose LDV McDaniel.  At defense counsel table is legal intern Dean Sobcic  Attorney Jack T Eichorst in court for State of Wisconsin.   Jury panel in box at 1:40 pm.  Voir dire proceeded. Two Individual voir dire held in chambers/ Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impaneled and sworn. Jury out of box at 3.19 pm.  Jury list received and filed.
Jury panel in court at 12:01 pm.  Jury panel sworn.  Court instructed the jury panel.  Jury panel recessed for lunch at 12:05 pm and instructed to return to jury management at 1:15 pm.

Defendant Ambrose LDV McDaniel in court.  Attorney Colleen A Taylor in court for Ambrose LDV McDaniel.  At defense counsel table is legal intern Dean Sobcic. IT IS ORDERED that the motions are dismissed. Ther is no matter pending before this court involving Mr. McDaniel in which this court's jurisdiction has been properly invoked. Mr. McDaniel's motions reference State v. McDaniel, Milwaukee County Case No. 2022CF226. According to the Wisconsin Circuit Court Access (WCCA) website, that case remains pending before the Milwaukee County Circuit Court. In such situations, requests for relief should ordinarily be filed in the trial court. Futhermore , according to WCCA entries for Milwaukee County Case No. 2022CF226, Mr. Mcdaniel is represented by counsel in that case.
